a.title: Go to North Warren Regional School District

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

div.p: North Warren Regional is a public secondary school district, serving students in grades 7-12 in the townships of Blairstown, Frelinghuysen, Hardwick, and Knowlton. The district covers 96.8 square miles bordering the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area in scenic Warren County.

div.style: background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-variant-ligatures: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2;

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 18pt;

b.span: RELEASE: Gottheimer Launches #NJ5ThanksYou to Highlight Fifth District Heroes During Coronavirus Pandemic

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 18pt;

b.span: Gottheimer Honors North Warren Regional High School STEM Teacher and Robotics Team Making Face Shields for Front-Line Workers

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 18pt;

i.span: NWR teacher Don Biery and students use 3D printers to create face shields and redesigned mask head straps for front-line health care workers

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 18pt;

i.span: Nearly 600 face shields have been delivered to local hospitals

span.style: border: 1pt none windowtext; color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 18pt; padding: 0in;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

i.span: Above: Don Biery and the North Warren Regional High School’s robotics team, Children of the Corn, are utilizing 3D printers donated by Imperial Machine and Tool to create face shields.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
color: #500050; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: - On April 27, 2020, U.S. Congressman Josh Gottheimer (NJ-5) launched #NJ5ThanksYou to regularly honor local heroes who are finding ways to support the North Jersey community throughout the coronavirus pandemic.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: Today, Gottheimer is honoring North Warren Regional High School STEM teacher and robotics team coach Don Biery and his students who are using donated 3D printers to create hundreds of face shields for front-line health care workers.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: Don Biery, who has been teaching at North Warren Regional High School for 11 years, and his students are utilizing 3D printers donated by Joe Sinclair from Warren County’s Imperial Machine and Tool in Columbia. Biery distributed the printers and necessary materials to students and has been regularly communicating with students via video conference calls to troubleshoot and solve any design or technology issues. Cardboard boxes to transport finished face shields have been donated by Warren County’s Brandt Box and Paper Co. Inc. in Columbia.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: Due to complaints about face mask ear straps irritating workers, Biery and the students have created redesigned head straps to be used on masks as well. Nearly 360 ear straps have been delivered to front-line medical workers in the region.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: “Our new #NJ5ThanksYou initiative is to honor members of our North Jersey who are going above and beyond the call of duty to help out during these challenging times. I want to thank North Warren Regional High School teacher Don Biery and their robotics team for helping get our front-line health care workers more equipment that they need to be able to protect themselves and do their job safely,”

span.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
color: #500050; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: “It’s great to see the innovation taking place by North Jersey students, and that their efforts are going to support our local hospitals, like Hackettstown Medical Center and Newton Medical Center. Don and his students’ initiative is truly inspirational and we thank them for their hard work.”

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: “I’ve always said that I hoped that my students would learn skills that could help them change the world and the future and now they are getting a chance to show that they can help society today,”

span.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

b.span: said North Warren Regional High School STEM teacher and robotics team coach Don Biery.

span.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: “It’s hard to put into words the amount of how proud I am of my robotics students because there was no hesitation in wanting to help in any way they could. We're all a community out here in Warren County and it’s a wonderful place to be because everyone is willing to help each other.”

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: Biery has delivered the finished face shields and mask ear straps to the Blairstown Office of Emergency Management and local and regional hospitals and medical centers, including Hackettstown Medical Center and Newton Medical Center.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

div.span: Biery and the team are also looking into delivering the mask ear straps to essential workers in the local community who wear masks all day, including grocery store workers, gas station attendants, restaurant workers, and delivery workers.

span.style: color: black; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

i.span: Below: North Warren Regional High School robotics student Richard Pilny stands with 3D-printed face shields.

span.style: color: #132857; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;
color: #132857; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;
color: #132857; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 9pt;

div.span: 65 Harristown Rd, Suite 104, Glen Rock, NJ

div.div:
Please see the attached update from Ms. Bilotti.
COVID UPDATE April 24 2020

If you have not ordered your cap & gown yet, you MUST do so by Friday, May 1, or you will not receive one. There will be NO other opportunity to order after May 1. You can order the package (includes cap, gown, and tassel) or just a tassel (if you already have a cap and gown).
Please use the website below to order from Jostens.
https://www.jostens.com/apps/catalog/packageBrowse.mvc?customerId=1057825&customerName=North+Warren+Regional+High+School&catalogOsr=GRAD_PROD_HS_SENIOR_CUSTOMER_CATALOG&categoryOsr=REGALIA
If you have any questions, please contact Karen Black at kblack@northwarren.org.

article.aria-label: Board of Education Meeting: April 27 Agenda

div.h3: Board of Education Meeting: April 27 Agenda
div.div:
The April 27, 2020 North Warren Regional Board of Education Meeting will be held virtually via Zoom Webinar. The public is invited to view the meeting by following the link below. The meeting will begin at 6:00pm. Directions for public comment will be made available at the meeting.
When: Apr 27, 2020 06:00 PM
Topic: NWR BOE April 27 2020
Please click the link below to join the webinar:
https://northwarren.zoom.us/j/93691952379
Or iPhone one-tap :
US: +19292056099,,93691952379# or +16465189805,,93691952379#
Or Telephone:
Dial:
US: +1 929 205 6099
Webinar ID: 936 9195 2379
Agenda
div.a: View Original Post about Board of Education Meeting: April 27 Agenda

div.div:
North Warren Regional is again recognized as the top-ranked high school in Warren County!
The US News & World Report rankings released today, April 23, 2020, place North Warren Regional 1st out of 7 high schools in Warren County and 11th out of the 41 schools in the Lehigh Valley.
We are so proud of our students and teachers for the incredible work that they do throughout the year and are happy that their hard work is recognized by institutions like US News & World Report.
We are very excited to rank #1 for the second year in a row!
https://www.usnews.com/education/best-high-schools/pennsylvania/rankings/allentown-pa-10900
div.a: View Original Post about US News & World Report Rankings

article.aria-label: Special Video Message from our Staff to our Students

div.h3: Special Video Message from our Staff to our Students
div.div: Patriot Power Stay Strong Stay Safe Stay Positive
div.a: View Original Post about Special Video Message from our Staff to our Students

div.div:
This message is for all 10th, 11th, and 12th grade students and parents:
We have been working to support our students as we transition to virtual instruction and our very creative instructional-tech department has figured out a way to get laptops in the hands of all students. They have been working over the past two weeks to disassemble all of our Chromebook carts, gather all spare machines, and simultaneously negotiate a very low rate for a number of additional "new old stock" Chromebooks. We now have enough laptops to distribute to all 10th-, 11th-, and 12th-grade students. These are almost identical to the Chromebooks that students in the lower grades are using but may vary slightly. We will be distributing them this week so students receive them before spring break.
12th-grade students will need to return the Chromebooks at the end of the school year.
10th- and 11th-grade students will be permitted to keep the Chromebooks at home over the summer until the start of the school year when they will be expected to bring them to school daily, similarly to our lower-grade students.
We will be DELIVERING these to the homes of all 10th, 11th, and 12th-grade students and deliveries will run along existing bus routes, which means we will be starting with students who are on Route 101, then Route 102, etc. We expect this distribution to take two to three days to complete and will be starting with Route 101 and progressing numerically.
Our staff will drop this device off on your front porch, ring the bell/knock, and then return to their vehicle. Please do not engage with or speak to the staff as we practice appropriate physical distancing. Our staff will follow CDC protocols for deliveries and will be equipped with gloves, masks, and disinfectants.
IMPORTANT:
If you do not wish to have the laptop delivered to you or will not have someone home to gather the laptop from your porch or for any reason do not want us to deliver this device over the next three days, please email Ms. Blanchette right away and we will delay delivery.
Email: mblanchette@northwarren.org
You can also call the school back at this number and hit #7 for Ms. Kuhar's extension and leave a voicemail. We are checking our voicemail remotely.
We will update you with another call at the end of the day tomorrow so you know where we are with our distribution cycle.
Thank you,
Sarah Bilotti
Superintendent
North Warren Regional School District
10 Noe Road, Blairstown, NJ 07825
p: 908-362-9342
f: 908-362-8744
@NorthWarrenHS
@Sarah_Bilotti
www.northwarren.org
